Installation¶

Compysition¶

Pypi¶

You can install the latest stable version of Compysition from https://pypi.python.org/pypi/compysition/ by using easy_install or pip:

$ easy_install compysition

Or

$ pip install compysition

All dependencies should be resolved automatically.

From source¶

You can install the latest stable or development version from https://github.com/smetj/compysition

Stable¶

$ git clone https://github.com/smetj/compysition
$ cd compysition
$ cd checkout master #just in case your repo is in another branch
$ sudo python setup.py install

Development¶

To install the latest development release you have to checkout the develop branch and build from there:

$ git clone https://github.com/smetj/compysition.git
$ cd compysition
$ git checkout develop
$ sudo python setup.py install

Verify installation¶

Once installed you should have the compysition executable available in your search path:

$ compysition --help
usage: compysition [-h] {start,debug,stop,kill,list,show} ...

Compysition bootstrap server.

positional arguments:
  {start,debug,stop,kill,list,show}

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit

Modules¶

Builtin modules¶

Compysition comes with a set of builtin modules. You can verify the available default modules by using the list command:

$ compysition list
Available Compysition modules:
+---------------------------+-------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Group                     | Module            | Version | Description                                                          |
+---------------------------+-------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| compysition.builtin.logging  | loglevelfilter    | 0.4.8   | Filters Compysition log events.                                         |
|                           | humanlogformatter | 0.4.8   | Formats Compysition log events.                                         |
|                           |                   |         |                                                                      |
| compysition.builtin.metrics  | graphite          | 0.4.8   | Converts the internal metric format to Graphite format.              |
|                           |                   |         |                                                                      |
| compysition.builtin.flow     | roundrobin        | 0.4.8   | Round-robins incoming events to all connected queues.                |
|                           | fanout            | 0.4.8   | Duplicates incoming events to all connected queues.                  |
|                           | tippingbucket     | 0.4.8   | Event buffer module.                                                 |
|                           | funnel            | 0.4.8   | Merges incoming events from multiple queues to 1 queue.              |
|                           | lockbuffer        | 0.4.8   | A module with a fixed size inbox queue.                              |
|                           |                   |         |                                                                      |
| compysition.builtin.function | header            | 0.4.8   | Adds information to event headers.                                   |
|                           |                   |         |                                                                      |
| compysition.builtin.input    | testevent         | 0.4.8   | Generates a test event at the chosen interval.                       |
|                           |                   |         |                                                                      |
| compysition.builtin.output   | syslog            | 0.4.8   | Writes log events to syslog.                                         |
|                           | null              | 0.4.8   | Purges incoming events..                                             |
|                           | stdout            | 0.4.8   | Prints incoming events to STDOUT.                                    |
|                           | slow              | 0.4.8   | Processes an incoming event per X seconds.                           |
|                           |                   |         |                                                                      |
+---------------------------+-------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+

Modules are stored into a hierarchic name space. The complete name of a module consists out of the group name + the module name. You can read the details of a module by executing the show command:

$ compysition show compysition.builtin.input.testevent
**Generates a test event at the chosen interval.**

    This module is only available for testing purposes and has further hardly any use.

    Events have following format:

        { "header":{}, "data":"test" }

    Parameters:

        - name (str):               The instance name when initiated.

        - interval (float):         The interval in seconds between each generated event.
                                    Should have a value > 0.
                                    default: 1

    Queues:

        - outbox:    Contains the generated events.

External modules¶

Not all modules are builtin modules. There is a collection of modules which can be downloaded from https://github.com/smetj/compysitionModules. The reason they are not builtin modules is to limit the number of dependencies for Compysition itself. All modules are also in 1 repository. Within time they will be available as separate projects and added to Pypi.

To install an external module follow these steps:

$ git clone https://github.com/smetj/compysitionModules.git
$ cd wb_output_tcp
$ python setup.py install
$ compysition show compysition.output.tcp
**A Compysition IO module which writes data to a TCP socket.**

Writes data to a tcp socket.

Parameters:

    - name (str):       The instance name when initiated.

    - host (string):    The host to submit to.
                        Default: "localhost"

    - port (int):       The port to submit to.
                        Default: 19283

    - timeout(int):     The time in seconds to timeout when
                        connecting
                        Default: 1

    - delimiter(str):   A delimiter to add to each event.
                        Default: "\n"

    - success (bool):   When True, submits succesfully outgoing
                        events to the 'success' queue.
                        Default: False

    - failed (bool):    When True, submits failed outgoing
                        events to the 'failed' queue.
                        Default: False

Queues:

    - inbox:    Incoming events submitted to the outside.

    - success:  Contains events which went out succesfully.
                (optional)

    - failed:   Contains events which did not go out successfully.
                (optional)
